item.description: Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0349; 08:26AM; 320 N Juanita Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3nZ0E2x; #EastHollywood; 58 firefighters took just 21 minutes in offensive operations to access, confine and fully extinguish fire within a vacant 40' x 100' one-story commercial building. No injury. Fire cause under investigation; FS 6; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 BC5 CM22 E11 E211 E220 E235 E52 E6 EM25 EM5 RA6 RA806 T11 T20 T35; CH9; 14; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0349; 08:05AM; 320 N Juanita Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3nZ0E2x; #EastHollywood; PRELIM: Vacant 40' x 100' one-story commercial building; FS 6; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 BC5 CM22 E11 E211 E220 E235 E52 E6 EM5 RA6 RA806 T11 T20 T35; CH9; 14; Brian Humphrey

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1609; 08:54PM; 225 W 25th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3qXmkOw; Historic South-Central; KNOCKDOWN: 29 firefighters extinguished the fire in 20 minutes with no injuries reported. The fire was contained to the unit of origin and prevented from extending into the adjacent units. The smoke is currently being cleared from the building. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 E10 E14 E15 E210 E215 RA15 SQ21 T10 T15; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1609; 08:34PM; 225 W 25th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3qXmkOw; Historic South-Central; Three story, center hall apartment building with fire in one unit on the 3rd floor, being held in check by fire sprinklers. Firefighters are in the offensive mode.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 E10 E15 E210 SQ21 T10; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Update Structure Fire; INC#0411; 09:32AM; 255 S Grand Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IDEECt; Downtown; Firefighters responded to reports of patients on both the 16th and 19th floor, made contact and determined no medical aid was needed. Occupants remain sheltered in place. There were workers on the roof of the building and firefighters ascended the interior stairwell to the roof to locate them and escort them safely down/out of the building (elevators can not be used at this time). The building engineer and LAFD Fire Prevention Bureau Inspector are on scene to operate the building's smoke removal system to clear the remaining smoke out of the structure. One patient was transported (as reported in earlier alert) with burn injuries. No other occupants have required medical aid or transport. Additional calls are coming from occupants in various units within the building and the LAFD Metropolitan Fire Communications (MFC) 9-1-1 center is providing that information to the Incident Commander who is deploying a fire company to investigate each one. They will make contact with the occupants and provide what assistance is required. ; FS 3; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; Margaret Stewart

Update Structure Fire; INC#0411; 09:04AM; 255 S Grand Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IDEECt; Downtown; Firefighters recalled all elevators and all occupants are clear out of the elevators (number of people who were stuck is unknown). It is unknown at this time if any of the elevator occupants are requiring medical assistance. Firefighters are investigating reports of one patient on a balcony (approximately 16th floor). One patient (age/gender unknown), from inside the restaurant under renovation, was transported with burn injuries (extent and condition unknown). All airborne firefighting units were canceled. Media staging is at 333 Grand Av (Wells Fargo building). ; FS 3; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 AR11 AR35 AR9 BC1 BC11 BC14 CM21 CM22 E11 E14 E20 E202 E203 E209 E210 E211 E220 E227 E239 E27 E273 E3 E39 E9 E90 EA1 EM1 EM11 EM18 HR3 RA11 RA209 RA27 RA3 RA4 RA803 RA9 SQ21 T10 T11 T2 T20 T27 T3 T39 T73 T9 UR27 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Margaret Stewart

Update Structure Fire; INC#0411; 08:47AM; 255 S Grand Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IDEECt; Downtown; Firefighters quickly extinguished a fire located in the ground floor restaurant undergoing renovation. The fire was contained to the restaurant (unconfirmed initial reports of possible explosion in the kitchen) but the smoke has traveled (to varying degrees) up through the building. Firefighters are in the process of locating/recalling all elevators in the building (27 floors) and assisting anyone who may be stuck (number of possible patients is unknown at this time). Preliminary reports of one possible burn patient from the restaurant (condition unknown). While this is at a Major Emergency status, the fire is extinguished and the incident is in the search and rescue phase. Media staging is at 333 Grand Ave (Wells Fargo Building). LAFD Arson section is responding per protocol.; FS 3; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC14 CM21 CM22 E11 E14 E20 E202 E203 E209 E210 E211 E220 E227 E239 E27 E273 E3 E39 E9 E90 EM1 EM11 H1 H2 H5 H6 HA1 HA2 HA5 HA6 HR3 RA11 RA209 RA27 RA3 RA803 SQ21 T10 T11 T2 T20 T27 T3 T39 T73 T9 UR27 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0411; 08:29AM; 255 S Grand Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IDEECt; Downtown; A well established fire in a restaurant on the ground floor of a multi-story, high rise building. A total of five additional task forces requested (not reflected in this alert). There are (unconfirmed) reports of persons (number unknown) stuck in elevators. This will significantly impact traffic in the area, please avoid. PIOs Cpt Erik Scott and Firefighter David Ortiz are enroute for media availability. ; FS 3; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E203 E209 E3 E9 RA3 SQ21 T3 T9; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart

Update Trapped Vehicle - Fatality; INC#0348; 08:12AM; Wb 118 Fy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3nVT6Od; Mission Hills; The collision involved two vehicles, a panel truck in which a male occupant was extricated and a work truck towing a trailer. The two patients (both adult males) transported are in *at least* serious condition. LAFD has turned over the incident to CHP which is now the agency for any further updates. ; FS 75; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E275 E298 E7 EM15 HR3 RA18 RA7 RA81 RA87 T75 T98 UR88; CH8; 17; Margaret Stewart

Physical Rescue - FATALITY; INC#0348; 07:32AM; Wb 118 Fy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3nVT6Od; Mission Hills; Multi-vehicle (number of cars unknown at this time) traffic collision with a (current) total of three patients, one of which was determined deceased on scene. One patient is trapped and requiring extrication (underway). Age/gender/condition of the patients is unknown at this time. This will significantly impact traffic - refer to https://cad.chp.ca.gov/Traffic.aspx for CHP updates. Media queries are referred to CHP Log# 0665 ; FS 75; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E275 E7 EM15 RA7 RA81 RA87 T75; CH8; 17; Margaret Stewart
